<!--Do not add details like "Dr."; see naming conventions at WP:MOSBIO-->'''Michael Alan Weiner''' (born March 31, 1942), better known by his professional name '''Michael Savage''',<ref name="newyorker.com">{{cite web|date=August 3, 2009|title=Party of One, Michael Savage, unexpurgated.|author=Kelefa, Sanneh|url=http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2009/08/03/party-of-one-2|work=[[The New Yorker]]}}</ref> is an American [[Radio personality|radio host]], author, activist, nutritionist, and conservative political commentator. He is the host of ''[[The Savage Nation]]'', a [[Broadcast syndication#Radio syndication|nationally syndicated]] talk show that aired on [[Talk Radio Network]] across the United States until 2012, and in 2009 was the second most listened-to radio talk show in the country with an audience of over 20 million listeners on 400 stations across the United States.<ref name="Hinckley">{{cite news |last=Hinckley |first=David |title=Barack Obama critics, like Rush Limbaugh, top annual list of influential radio hosts |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/2010/02/24/2010-02-24_righties_lead_talk_allstar_team.html |access-date=June 26, 2011 |newspaper=New York Daily News |date=February 24, 2010}}</ref><ref name="Marinucci">{{cite news |last=Marinucci |first=Carla |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/nov05election/detail?entry_id=39618 |title=Politics Blog : SF radio host Michael Savage, banned from Britain: "Will they ban my listeners too?" |publisher=SFGate |date=May 5, 2009 |access-date=October 5, 2009}}</ref> Since October 23, 2012, Michael Savage has been syndicated by [[Cumulus Media Networks]]. He holds [[master's degree]]s from the [[University of Hawaii at Manoa|University of Hawaii]] in medical [[botany]] and [[medical anthropology]], and a Ph.D. from the [[University of California, Berkeley]] in [[nutrition]]al [[ethnomedicine]]. As Michael Weiner, he has written books on [[nutrition]], [[Herbalism|herbal medicine]], and [[homeopathy]]; as Michael Savage, he has written four political books that have reached ''[[The New York Times Best Seller list]]''.
Savage has summarized his political philosophy in three words: [[border]]s, language, and culture. Savage has characterized his views as conservative [[American nationalism|nationalism]], while critics have characterized them as "fostering [[extremism]]."<ref name="least wanted">{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/8033060.stm | work=BBC News | title=UK 'least wanted' list published | date=May 5, 2009}}</ref> He supports the [[English-only movement]] and argues that [[Modern liberalism in the United States|liberalism]] and [[Progressivism in the United States|progressivism]] are degrading [[Culture of the United States|American culture]]. Although his radio delivery is mainly characterized as politically themed, he also often covers topics such as medicine, nutrition, music, literature, history, theology, philosophy, sports, business, economics, and culture, and tells personal anecdotes.
Since 2009, Savage has been [[List of people banned from entering the United Kingdom|barred from entering the United Kingdom]] for "seeking to provoke others to serious criminal acts and fostering hatred."{{refn|<ref name="least wanted" /><ref>Savage forbidden from Britain: "Britain...published its first list of people barred from entering the country" [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2009/05/05/michael-savage-banned-fro_n_196631.html The Huffington Post]</ref><ref>[http://www.americanthinker.com/2009/05/michael_savage_banned_in_the_u.html Document quotes:] "Home Office name promoters of hate excluded from the United Kingdom," Savage "seeking to provoke others to serious criminal acts and fostering [[hatred]] which might lead to inter-community violence."</ref><ref>BBC: "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/8035114.stm%20 US 'hate list' DJ to sue Britain]" May 6, 2009,</ref>}} <!-- see [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style (lead section)]] "Provide an accessible overview" " It should define the topic, establish context, explain why the subject is interesting or notable, and summarize the most important points—including any prominent controversies. " etc... This has since been revealed through emails and other media to characterize Savage as a scapegoat. -->
==Early life and education== Savage was born Michael Alan Weiner<ref name="newyorker.com" /> in [[the Bronx]], New York, one of three children of Benjamin and Rae Weiner,<ref name="mother" /> [[History of the Jews in Russia|Jewish]] emigrants from Russia.<ref name="mother" /><ref name="sfsavage">{{cite news |first=Ron |last=Russell |title=Inside the Savage Nation |url=http://www.sfweekly.com/2006-07-19/news/inside-the-savage-nation/full |work=[[SF Weekly]] |date=July 19, 2006 |access-date=September 21, 2007 }}</ref><ref name="New Yorker" /><ref name="man behind">{{cite news |first=Mark |last=de la Viña |title=The Man Behind the "Savage Nation": Neo-Conservative Host Once Embraced the Counterculture |url=http://www.bayarea.com/mld/mercurynews/entertainment/television/6336570.htm |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030801234541/http://www.bayarea.com/mld/mercurynews/entertainment/television/6336570.htm |archivedate=August 1, 2003 |work=[[The Mercury News|San Jose Mercury News]] |date=July 20, 2003 |access-date=September 21, 2007 }}</ref> He described his childhood as difficult.<ref name="sfsavage" /> His little brother, Jerome, was born with developmental disabilities and was unable to hear or speak. Jerome died in 1969. His father, the owner of an antiques shop, died of a heart attack at age 57<ref name="New Yorker" /> in 1970,<ref>{{cite web|title=Michael Savage|work=[[NNDB]]|url=http://www.nndb.com/people/588/000044456/}}</ref> and his mother died in 2003.<ref name="mother">{{cite news|title=Paid Notice: Deaths Savage, Rae|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2003/12/16/classified/paid-notice-deaths-savage-rae.html|access-date=July 12, 2011|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=December 16, 2003}}</ref>
After graduating from [[Jamaica High School (New York City)|Jamaica High School]] in 1958,<ref>{{cite web|title=Noteworthy alumni|url=http://www.jamaicahighschool.org/ALUM/notealum.htm|publisher=Jamaica High School (New York City)|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090904080202/http://www.jamaicahighschool.org/ALUM/notealum.htm|archivedate=September 4, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Otterman|first=Sharon|title=Jamaica High May Close, but Memories Will Live On|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/01/24/nyregion/24jamaica.html|access-date=July 21, 2011|newspaper=The New York Times|date=January 24, 2010}}</ref> Savage attended [[Queens College, City University of New York|Queens College]], where he earned a bachelor's degree in [[biology]] in 1963.<ref name="New Yorker" /> After college Savage taught high school for several years in New York City. His first marriage in 1964 to Carol Ely ended in divorce, and he remarried in 1967 after meeting his current wife, Janet. During this time Savage also worked for famous [[psychedelic drug]] advocate [[Timothy Leary]] as keeper of the stone gatehouse on the Hitchcock Cattle Company estate in [[Millbrook, New York]], to which Leary had been given access. Leary hired him to the post because Savage did not use [[Lysergic acid diethylamide|LSD]].<ref name="sfsavage" /> Savage then studied at the [[University of Hawaii at Manoa]], earning a [[Master of Science]] in [[botany]] in 1970 and a [[Master of Arts]] in [[anthropology]] in 1972.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Weiner|first=Michael Alan|title=Medicinal plants of Tonga|url=http://scholarspace.manoa.hawaii.edu/bitstream/handle/10125/36042/Weiner_1970_r.pdf|publisher=University of Hawaii at Manoa|year=1970|format=Thesis (M.A.)}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Graduate Degrees Awarded in Anthropology: MAs - 1970 to 1979|url=http://www.anthropology.hawaii.edu/people/alumni/mas1970-1979.html|publisher=University of Hawaii at Manoa|access-date=June 3, 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150825092120/http://anthropology.hawaii.edu/people/alumni/mas1970-1979.html|archivedate=August 25, 2015|df=mdy-all}}</ref> He obtained a [[Doctor of Philosophy|PhD]] in 1978 from the [[University of California, Berkeley]], in [[nutrition]]al [[ethnomedicine]].<!--<ref name="UCBL">{{cite web |url=http://sunsite5.berkeley.edu:8000/WebZ/FETCH?sessionid=01-49886-1724585769&recno=14&resultset=2&format=F&next=html/record.html&bad=error/badfetch.html&:entitytoprecno=14:entitycurrecno=14 |title="UC Berkeley Pathfinder" |access-date=October 5, 2006 |format= |work=}}</ref> --><ref name=mrangry>{{cite news | title = Michael Savage: Mr Angry | author=Guy Adams | url = https://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/michael-savage-mr-angry-1681844.html | work=The Independent | publisher=Independent News & Media PLC | location = London | date = May 9, 2009 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100716195310/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/profiles/michael-savage-mr-angry-1681844.html|archivedate=July 16, 2010 }}</ref> His [[thesis]] was titled ''Nutritional Ethnomedicine in [[Fiji]]''.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Weiner|first=Michael Alan|year=1978|title=Nutritional ethnomedicine in Fiji|url=http://catalogue.nla.gov.au/Record/3287378|work=Dissertation Abstracts International|volume=41|issue=12|page=4468|format=Thesis (Ph.D.)}}</ref>
==Shift in political opinions== Savage introduced himself to certain writers in the [[North Beach, San Francisco|North Beach]] neighborhood of San Francisco in the 1970s.<ref name="salon">{{cite web|url=http://www.salon.com/2003/03/05/savage_11/singleton/ |title=Michael Savage's long, strange trip |access-date=November 10, 2011 |last=Gilson |first=David |date=March 5, 2003 |publisher=Salon.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111121163922/http://www.salon.com/2003/03/05/savage_11/singleton/ |archivedate=November 21, 2011 |df=mdy }}</ref> He befriended and traveled with [[Beat Generation|Beat]] poets [[Allen Ginsberg]] and [[Lawrence Ferlinghetti]]. Savage maintained a correspondence with Ginsberg consisting of ten letters and three postcards across four years, which is maintained with Ginsberg's papers at [[Stanford University]].<ref name="sfsavage" /><ref name="GQ">{{cite news |last=Tapper |first=Jake |authorlink=Jake Tapper |date=September 2003 |title=The Savage Mind |work=[[GQ]]}}</ref> One letter asked for Ginsberg and Ferlinghetti to come do a poetry reading, so others could "hear and see and know why I adore your public image."<ref name="man behind" /> Another acquaintance was poet and author [[Neeli Cherkovski]], who says that Savage dreamed of becoming a [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comic]] in the mold of [[Lenny Bruce]].<ref name="sfsavage" />
Acquaintance Robert Cathcart says that by 1980, in his private conversations with Savage, he knew him to have conservative political views.<ref name="salon" /> Schwartz stated Savage became alienated from the North Beach scene in the early 1980s. Savage had intense arguments with his liberal friends.<ref name="salon" /> When asked about his shift in politics and other views, Savage replied, "I was once a child; I am now a man."<ref name="man behind" /> Savage has cited many occurrences in his life that helped shape his conservative views. Savage states that his opinions on [[welfare]] were partly shaped by his first job out of college as a [[social work]]er.<ref>{{cite book |last = Savage |first = Michael |title = The Savage Nation |publisher=[[Thomas Nelson (publisher)|Thomas Nelson]] |year= 2002 |page = 181 |isbn = 0-7852-6353-5 }}</ref> He described one incident in which his supervisor had him deliver a check to a welfare client to furnish their apartment, while his own apartment was furnished with cardboard boxes.<ref name="Playboy" /> Another turning point occurred for him as a writer of health and nutrition books in the 1980s, when he experienced what he saw as "political opposition" after making the suggestion that the closure of homosexual bathhouses might be necessary in response to the emerging [[HIV/AIDS]] epidemic.<ref>{{cite book |last= Savage |first = Michael A. |title = Maximum Immunity |publisher=[[Houghton Mifflin Harcourt|Houghton Mifflin]] |year= 1986 |page = 207 |isbn = 0-395-37910-5 }}</ref> In 1994 his final health and nutrition manuscript, ''Immigrants and Epidemics'', was rejected by publishers for being inflammatory.<ref>{{cite web |last = Hirsen |first = James L. |title = Savage Exposes 'The Enemy Within' |publisher=FirstLiberties.com |date = January 28, 2004|url = http://www.firstliberties.com/savage_exposes_enemy.html |access-date = September 20, 2007 }}</ref> In 1996, Savage applied to become the Dean of the [[UC Berkeley Graduate School of Journalism|Graduate School of Journalism]] at the [[University of California, Berkeley]]. The University instead selected award-winning journalist and China scholar [[Orville Schell]]. Savage sued the University, contending discrimination for being conservative.<ref name="salon" /> Savage later dropped the lawsuit.<ref name="Savage Talk" />
==Career as commentator== {{Main|The Savage Nation}}
===Radio=== The rejection by publishers of his 1994 manuscript about [[illegal immigration]] and [[epidemic]]s prompted Savage to record a demo tape with a mock radio talk show about the contents of the work. He mailed this tape to 250 radio stations in an attempt to change careers and become a radio talk show host.<ref name="salon" /><ref name="barbs">{{Cite AV media |people = Michael Savage |title = The Best of the Savage Nation – Volume 2: Barbs on the Berries |medium = CD |publisher=Savage Productions |date= 2003 }}</ref> On March 21, 1994, Savage began his radio career on [[KGO (AM)|KGO]] (a San Francisco news/[[talk radio]] station) as a fill-in host for the liberal [[Ray Taliaferro]] and later as a weekend host. At the time, his slogan was "To the right of [[Rush Limbaugh|Rush]] and to the left of God." On January 1, 1995, he was given his own show during the drive-time hours on sister station KSFO. The show quickly became a local hit. During his time at KSFO, Savage reached #1 in [[Nielsen Audio|Arbitron]] ratings among both adult men and women over 18 during afternoon drive-time in San Francisco and became top talk host in his time-slot.
In mid 2006, Savage had 8–10 million listeners per week,<ref>{{cite web |title = The Top Talk Radio Audiences |publisher=Talkers Magazine |date= September 2007 |url = http://www.talkers.com/main/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=17&Itemid=34|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20061114200439/http://www.talkers.com/main/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=17&Itemid=34|archivedate = November 14, 2006|access-date = June 24, 2009}}</ref> which made his show the third most widely heard broadcast in the United States at that time. Savage has described his listeners as "literate callers with intelligence, wit, and energy." He has described his show's production as one with a "... hard edge combined with humor and education ... Those who listen to me say they hear a bit of [[Plato]], [[Henry Miller]], [[Jack Kerouac]], [[Moses]], [[Jesus]], and [[Frankenstein]]."<ref name="MSB" /> Mark de la Viña of the ''[[The Mercury News|San Jose Mercury News]]'' wrote of Savage: "In contrast to Rush Limbaugh, [[Sean Hannity]] and [[Laura Schlessinger]], Bay Area-based Savage mixes conservative diatribe and blunt observations with acerbic humor and the gift of gab."<ref name="man behind" />
By 2009, ''The Savage Nation'' had an audience of 8 to 10 million listeners on 400 stations across the United States, making it the second most listened-to radio talk show in the country at the time.<ref name="Hinckley" /><ref name="Marinucci" /> Around that time, Savage asked his audience for their opinion prior to consenting to a profile interview by [[Kelefa Sanneh]] of ''[[The New Yorker]]''; Savage eventually accepted that offer and the ''New Yorker'' profile, titled "Party of One", was published in the August 3, 2009, issue, which covered Savage's life and personality in great detail.<ref name="New Yorker">{{cite journal|last=Sanneh |first=Kelefa |url=http://www.newyorker.com/reporting/2009/08/03/090803fa_fact_sanneh?currentPage=all |title=Party of One: Michael Savage, Unexpurgated |work=The New Yorker |date=August 3, 2009|pages=50–57|volume=85|issue=23|postscript=<!-- Bot inserted parameter. Either remove it; or change its value to "." for the cite to end in a ".", as necessary. -->{{inconsistent citations}}}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newyorker.com/online/2009/08/03/090803on_audio_sanneh |title=A podcast with Kelefa Sanneh |publisher=The New Yorker |date=August 3, 2009 |access-date=October 5, 2009}}</ref>
On September 10, 2009, [[KNEW (AM)|KNEW-AM]] (910 kHz) in Savage's home market of San Francisco announced that it was dropping his program and replacing him with [[John and Ken]] from sister station [[KFI]]-AM (640 kHz)/Los Angeles.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fong-Torres|first=Ben|title=Rothmann named as Ward's replacement|url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/entertainment/article/Rothmann-named-as-Ward-s-replacement-3285100.php|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=October 4, 2009|pages=Q40}}</ref> John Scott, program director of KNEW said in an e-mail that the station was headed "... in a different philosophical and ideological direction, featuring more contemporary content and more local information."<ref>{{cite news|title=Michael Savage off the air in S.F.|url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/article/Michael-Savage-off-the-air-in-S-F-3217723.php|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=September 11, 2009|pages=D4|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090914115152/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=%2Fc%2Fa%2F2009%2F09%2F11%2FBAEC19LCOS.DTL|archivedate=September 14, 2009|deadurl=no|access-date=May 2, 2018|df=mdy-all}}</ref> According to Arbitron monthly ratings, [[KNEW (AM)|KNEW-AM]] dropped in the ratings since Savage was let go. San Francisco station [[KTRB]] picked up the program for the San Francisco market, and saw a ratings boost in the afternoon drive. However, the program was among the first casualties when KTRB went into receivership in September 2010.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/athletics/article/A-s-radio-flagship-goes-bust-3175177.php | work=San Francisco Chronicle | first=Susan | last=Slusser | title=A's radio flagship goes bust | date=September 12, 2010 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101105095606/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=%2Fc%2Fa%2F2010%2F09%2F11%2FSPLP1FCB39.DTL | archivedate=November 5, 2010 | deadurl=no | page=B5 | access-date=May 2, 2018 | df=mdy-all }}</ref>
On January 22, 2010, Savage revealed to his audience that a writer for ''[[Playboy]]'' had contacted him via email to do a lengthy interview, and again asked his listeners if he should accept the offer. During the show, Savage read from personal emails between the ''Playboy'' writer and himself. The writer admitted to being a listener of the ''[[The Savage Nation|Savage Nation]]'' but a critic of the profile done by ''The New Yorker''. The writer also stated that the purpose of the interview was to "rattle" ''Playboy''{{'}}s readers. On May 12, 2010, Savage revealed that he had granted the interview at his home. ''Playboy'' published the interview in June 2010.<ref name="Playboy">{{cite web|last=Hochman |first=David |title=Michael Savage: Playboy interview |url=http://www.playboy.com/articles/michael-savage-playboy-interview/ |work=Playboy |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110511092038/http://www.playboy.com/articles/michael-savage-playboy-interview/ |archivedate=May 11, 2011 |date=June 2010 |deadurl=no }} .</ref> He read from a pre-publication copy of the 8,000-word ''Playboy'' interview, in which the writer expressed animosity for Savage and his views. Savage said that he was disappointed at the lack of [[journalistic objectivity]], but did not harbor hatred for the writer. He referred back to the ''New Yorker'' interview by Kelefa Sanneh, and praised Sanneh as a "real writer" who had understood his subject.
On September 27, 2012, Savage's talk show left the airwaves after he won a legal battle with [[Talk Radio Network]], his longtime employer, and his attorney said discussions with new networks were under way.<ref>{{cite news|last=McCartney|first=Anthony|title=Michael Savage leaves radio show after legal win|url=http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/U/US_PEOPLE_MICHAEL_SAVAGE?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&CTIME=2012-09-27-22-07-27|publisher=Associated Press|access-date=September 28, 2012|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120928071952/http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/U/US_PEOPLE_MICHAEL_SAVAGE?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&CTIME=2012-09-27-22-07-27|archivedate=September 28, 2012}}</ref> Savage began an occasional series of video webcasts via [[Ustream]] on September 30, 2012. On October 17, 2012, Savage and his new syndicator [[Cumulus Media Networks]] announced that they had made a deal and the program, after several weeks off the air, would be returning as of October 23, 2012.<ref>Marcucci, Carl. [http://rbr.com/cumulus-signs-michael-savage/ Cumulus signs Michael Savage]. ''Radio Business Report''. Retrieved October 17, 2012.</ref> By April 2013, according to the radio industry's ''[[Talkers Magazine]]'', Savage had 3.5+ million weekly listeners, putting him in a six-way tie for sixth place, and six talk show hosts getting 7.5+ million weekly listeners.<ref name="The Top Talk Radio Audiences">Talkers Magazine [http://www.talkers.com/top-talk-radio-audiences/ The Top Talk Radio Audiences] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140209101821/http://www.talkers.com/top-talk-radio-audiences/ |date=February 9, 2014 }}, retrieved April 2013</ref> On September 26, 2013 Cumulus Media Networks announced that Michael Savage's radio show, ''The Savage Nation'', would move to the 3p-6p ET time-slot beginning in January 2014. This time slot had been occupied by Sean Hannity.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/09/26/michael-savage-sean-hannity-cumulus_n_3995524.html|work=[[HuffPost|The Huffington Post]]|author=Fung, Katherine|title=Michael Savage Getting Sean Hannity's Timeslot|date=September 26, 2013}}</ref>
In January 2015, it was announced that Savage and Westwood One had reached agreement on a long-term contract renewal for ''The Savage Nation''.<ref>[http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/137287/michael-savage-renews-with-westwood-one/ "Michael Savage Renews With Westwood One"], Allaccess.com. January 14, 2015. Retrieved January 15, 2014.</ref>
===MSNBC television show=== Savage was hired by [[MSNBC]] president Erik Sorenson to do a one-hour show beginning March 8, 2003, despite Savage's previous criticism of the network in his book ''[[The Savage Nation (book)|The Savage Nation]]'' and the objections of [[NBC]] employees including news anchor [[Tom Brokaw]], who asked NBC executives, "Is this the sort of man who embodies the values of NBC?"<ref name="GQ" /> Sorenson, at the time, called Savage "brash, passionate and smart," and promised that he would provide "compelling opinion and analysis with an edge."<ref name="FAIR" />
Four months later, on July 7, Savage was fired from his MSNBC television show after remarks made in response to a caller, later identified as [[prank call]]er Bob Foster, who insulted Savage's teeth. Savage then asked if Foster was a "[[sodomy|sodomite]]", to which the caller answered, "Yes, I am." Savage then said to the caller,
{{quote|Oh, so you're one of those sodomites. You should only get [[HIV/AIDS|AIDS]] and die, you pig; how's that? Why don't you see if you can sue me, you pig? You got nothing better to do than to put me down, you piece of garbage? You got nothing to do today? Go eat a sausage, and choke on it. Get [[trichinosis]]. Now do we have another nice caller here who's busy because he didn't have a nice night in the bathhouse who's angry at me today? Put another, put another sodomite on ... no more calls? ... I don't care about these bums; they mean nothing to me. They're all sausages.<ref>{{cite news | title= MSNBC fires Michael Savage after anti-gay comments | date= July 7, 2003 | work=USA Today | url= https://www.usatoday.com/news/nation/2003-07-07-talk-host-fired_x.htm | access-date = June 14, 2009}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.democracynow.org/article.pl?sid=03/07/08/1510241 |title=MSNBC Fires Shock Host Michael Savage After He Tells Caller, "Get AIDS and Die, You Pig" |publisher=[[Democracy Now!]] |date=July 8, 2003 |access-date=September 27, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930165242/http://www.democracynow.org/article.pl?sid=03%2F07%2F08%2F1510241 |archivedate=September 30, 2007 |df= }}</ref>}}
The day after being fired, Savage apologized on his radio program and on his website. He explained that he believed that MSNBC had gone to commercial to cover the gaffe of the attempted sabotage by a prank caller and that he was off the air at the time of the offensive comments, despite the fact that clips of the segment show Savage going to commercial after he made the comments. He also said his remarks were meant only to insult the caller, not all people with AIDS.<ref>{{cite news |last=Fost |first=Dan |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2003/07/09/MN158024.DTL&ao=all |title=Savage Says He's Sorry But Stays Fired |work=San Francisco Chronicle |date=July 9, 2003 |access-date=September 27, 2007}}</ref>
==Political views== Michael Savage calls himself an "independent-minded individualist" and says that he "fits no stereotype."<ref name="MSB">{{cite web|title=Michael Savage : The Compassionate Conservative |publisher=WOR |url=http://www.wor710.com/pages/10608313.php |access-date=November 11, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111025112722/http://www.wor710.com/pages/10608313.php |archivedate=October 25, 2011 |df=mdy }}</ref> He has also cited [[Barry Goldwater]] as an influence.<ref name="Savaged NR">{{cite web|last=Klinghoffer|first=David|title=Savaged|url=http://www.nationalreview.com/articles/219016/savaged/david-klinghoffer|work=National Review|access-date=July 10, 2011|date=October 23, 2006}}</ref> Savage criticizes [[big government]] as well as [[Liberalism in the United States|liberalism]] and liberal activism, and accuses the [[Mainstream media|mainstream news media]] of [[Media bias|liberal bias]]. He considers the three aspects that define a nation as borders, language, and culture; those aspects inspired the motto of the Paul Revere Society.<ref name="Bush backers haven">{{cite news|last=Bulwa|first=Demian|title=Bush backers find a haven in city known for liberals|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2004/11/03/MNGVB9KUI81.DTL|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 3, 2004|pages=A16}}</ref> He is a strong advocate of [[wildlife preservation]], and has privately urged President Trump to support conservation in meetings at [[Mar-a-Lago]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://michaelsavage.com/2017/12/29/michael-talks-about-his-personal-meetings-with-president-trump-over-this-week-at-mar-a-lago-2/|title=Michael talks about his personal meetings with President Trump over this week at Mar-a-Lago|date=2017-12-30|work=The Savage Nation|access-date=2017-12-31|language=en-US}}</ref> This followed a series of pleas on his radio show for the President to support legislation that protected wildlife.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/please-mr-president-spare-the-elephants_us_5a2186f3e4b04dacbc9bd680|title=Please Mr. President, Spare the Elephants|last=Simms|first=Mary Lou|date=2017-12-02|website=[[HuffPost|The Huffington Post]] |language=en-US|access-date=2017-12-31}}</ref>
=== European Union === Savage describes the [[European Union]] as "Hitler's dream of a united Europe under German control." He equates Britain's [[United Kingdom European Union membership referendum, 2016|vote to leave the Union]] with the Second World War, saying it was "in many ways the [[Battle of Britain]] all over again." Savage foresees that, after [[Brexit]], the E.U. risks igniting a civil war to gain total control of the population for their plans of "a new Soviet-style superstate, which have been long on the drawing books."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LTcet3vbaiA|title=The Savage Nation – Episode 19|last=Savage|first=Michael|date=|website=YouTube|access-date=}}</ref>
=== Republican presidential candidates === In 2003, Savage said that he voted in [[United States presidential election, 2000|2000]] for [[George W. Bush]] "quite reluctantly, incidentally."<ref name="TalkBack Live">{{cite episode|title=Are SUV Owners Supporting Terrorism?; California Redefines Rape|url=http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0301/08/tl.00.html|series=TalkBack Live|serieslink=Talkback Live|network=CNN|airdate=January 8, 2003}}</ref> In [[United States presidential election, 2004|2004]], Savage and the Revere Society hosted a party at Schroeder's Cafe in San Francisco celebrating the re-election of Bush.<ref name="Bush backers haven" /> Savage donated $5,600 to the campaign of Democratic candidate [[Jerry Brown]] in the [[California Attorney General election, 2006|2006 California Attorney General election]].<ref>{{cite news|author1=Matier, Phil |author2=Ross, Andrew |lastauthoramp=yes |title=Has the mayor's new girlfriend, who is only 20, been drinking? |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2006/10/15/MNR.TMP |newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle |date=October 15, 2006 |pages=B1 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120309114412/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=%2Fc%2Fa%2F2006%2F10%2F15%2FMNR.TMP |archivedate=March 9, 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Savage strongly supported [[Donald Trump]], a regular guest on his talk show, since Trump's June 2015 announcement of his candidacy in the [[United States presidential election, 2016|United States 2016 presidential election]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = Michael Savage: Trump Is the 'Winston Churchill of Our Time'|url = http://www.newsmax.com/Headline/Michael-Savage-Donald-Trump-winston-churchill-supports/2015/07/29/id/659542/|website = Newsmax|access-date = January 28, 2016}}</ref> Trump has claimed to be a listener and a fan of Savage's show, and an April 2016 [[Salon (website)|Salon]] article described Savage as having been a major influence on Trump's campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.salon.com/2016/04/06/the_talk_radio_godfather_of_trumpamania_what_michael_savage_can_tell_us_about_americas_white_working_class/|title=The talk-radio godfather of Trumpamania: What Michael Savage can tell us about America’s white...|date=April 6, 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
=== White genocide === Savage subscribes to the [[white genocide conspiracy theory]],<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.splcenter.org/hatewatch/2018/02/01/michael-savage-promotes-white-nationalist-conspiracy-his-radio-show-wins-praise-racist |title=Michael Savage promotes white nationalist conspiracy on his radio show, wins praise from racist author |publisher=[[Southern Poverty Law Center]] |date=1 February 2018}}</ref> a [[white nationalism|white nationalist]] belief, which claims that [[white people]] are becoming extinct through forced assimilation or violent genocide. Savage blames [[Barack Obama]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.alternet.org/tea-party-and-right/5-failed-right-wing-prophecies-and-predictions-2015 |title=5 Failed Right-Wing Prophecies and Predictions of 2015 |publisher=[[AlterNet]] |date=28 December 2015}}</ref> and the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] for promoting the concept within the United States.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://forward.com/fast-forward/393497/jewish-talk-show-host-promotes-white-genocide-theory/ |title=Jewish Talk Show Host Promotes ‘White Genocide’ Theory |publisher=[[The Forward]] |date=2 February 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/michael-savage-obama-is-waging-white-genocide/ |title=Michael Savage: Obama Is Waging White Genocide |publisher=[[Right Wing Watch]] |date=5 May 2016}}</ref> He has claimed there is a "cultural genocide being promulgated against Caucasians".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.patheos.com/blogs/dispatches/2018/02/06/michael-savage-white-supremacists-favorite-jew/ |title=Michael Savage, the White Supremacists’ Favorite Jew |publisher=[[Patheos]] |date=6 February 2018}}</ref>
==Activism== ===Legal defense contributions=== Savage has regularly donated money toward the legal defense of the [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marines]] accused of [[Haditha massacre|murdering civilians]] in [[Haditha|Haditha, Iraq]]; occasionally, Savage will offer proceeds from any sales through his website. Savage had regular contact with the attorneys of the accused and criticizes their treatment at [[Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton|Camp Pendleton]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.homestead.com/prosites-prs/shackled.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071012164021/http://www.homestead.com/prosites-prs/shackled.html |archivedate=October 12, 2007 |title=Shackled Marine Update |access-date=September 21, 2007 |author=Jeremiah J. Sullivan, III }}</ref> Most recently, Savage has donated over $10,000 to the U.S. Marines Charity Defense Fund at the [[Thomas More Law Center]]<ref>{{cite web | title=Michael Savage, Thank You! | work=TMLC Blog | publisher=[[Thomas More Law Center]] | date=October 23, 2007 | url=http://www.thomasmore.org/qry/page.taf?id=20&_function=detail&sbtblct_uid1=125&_nc=afbbd8dc99e7ea25bdf33eb0bb91a170 | access-date=December 17, 2007 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081228021900/http://www.thomasmore.org/qry/page.taf?id=20&_function=detail&sbtblct_uid1=125&_nc=afbbd8dc99e7ea25bdf33eb0bb91a170 | archivedate=December 28, 2008 | df=mdy }} </ref> On April 25, 2007, he pledged $1 for each copy of ''Healing Children Naturally'' and ''Reducing the Risk of Alzheimer's'' purchased from his website to be donated to the U.S. Marines Defense Fund.<ref>{{cite web|last=Savage |first=Michael |title=Pendleton 8 Defense Fund |publisher=Pendleton8.com |url=http://www.pendleton8.com/index.html |access-date=September 20, 2007 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071017135322/http://pendleton8.com/index.html |archivedate=October 17, 2007 |df=mdy }}</ref> The Marines were ultimately found not guilty.
==Awards and criticism== ===Awards=== On June 9, 2007, ''[[Talkers Magazine]]'' awarded Savage with the publication's annual "Freedom of Speech Award," and he accepted it with a pre-recorded speech.<ref name="newsblaze.com">{{cite news|title=Savage Honored with Freedom of Speech Award |url=http://newsblaze.com/story/20070328082543nnnn.np/topstory.html |work=News Blaze |access-date=September 21, 2007 }}</ref>

===Criticism=== In July 2005, former CBS reporter [[Bernard Goldberg]] ranked Savage as number 61 in his book ''[[100 People Who Are Screwing Up America]]''. Goldberg wrote that "Savage's brand of over-the-top [[bile]] ... puts him right in there with the angriest haters of the [[Left-wing politics|Left]]."<ref>{{cite web | last =Dhingra | first =Philip | title =''Who is in Bernard Goldberg's 100 People Who Are Screwing Up America? And Why?'' | date =August 8, 2005 | url =http://www.philosophistry.com/specials/100-people.html |access-date =September 27, 2007}}</ref> [[David Klinghoffer]], a ''[[National Review]]'' columnist, speculated that ''The Savage Nation'' "is an act, a put-on."<ref name="Savaged NR" /> Various progressive advocacy groups such as [[GLAAD]] and [[Fairness and Accuracy in Reporting|FAIR]] accuse Savage of [[racism]], [[homophobia]], [[transphobia]], and [[Islamophobia]] because of his controversial statements about [[homosexuality]], [[Islam]], [[feminism]], [[sex education]], and [[immigration]].<ref name="FAIR">{{cite web |url=http://www.fair.org/index.php?page=1632 |title=GE, Microsoft Bring Bigotry to Life |publisher=[[Fairness and Accuracy in Reporting]] |date=February 12, 2003 |access-date =September 27, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.glaad.org/action/al_archive_detail.php?id=3257 |title=Urge MSNBC to Rethink TV Show for Anti-Gay "Savage" |publisher=[[GLAAD]] |date=February 26, 2003 |access-date =September 27, 2007 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20050930052118/http://www.glaad.org/action/al_archive_detail.php?id=3257 |archivedate = September 30, 2005}}</ref><ref>Steve Rendall and Isabel Macdonald, [http://www.fair.org/index.php?page=3648 Making Islamophobia Mainstream; How Muslim-bashers broadcast their bigotry], [[Fairness and Accuracy in Reporting]], November/December 2008.</ref>
On April 17, 2006, Savage was seriously criticized worldwide after he said on the topic of Muslims, "They say, 'Oh, there's a billion of them.' I said, 'So, kill 100 million of them, then there'll be 900 million of them.' I mean, would you rather die—would you rather us die than them?"<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/g/a/2008/01/04/oped_resp_stillwell.DTL |title= SF Chronicle Free Speech vs Hate Speech |access-date= May 10, 2009 | first=Safaa | last=Ibrahim | date=January 3, 2008 | work=The San Francisco Chronicle}}</ref> This was taken from an argument dealing with the possibility of a nuclear conflict in that region. This was repeated in the media after Savage was barred from entering the UK.<ref name="Ref-4">{{cite web|work=[[The Guardian]]|title=Barring this shock-jock from Britain risks turning a rabid blabbermouth into a beacon for free speech|author=Leith, Sam|date=May 6, 2009|url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2009/may/07/radio-michael-savage-ban-britain}}</ref>
In the wake of the actor [[Robin Williams]]' [[suicide]], Savage said that suicide is an "aggressive act" that shows no consideration for loved ones left behind.<ref name=MM>{{cite web|work=[[Media Matters for America]]|url=http://mediamatters.org/blog/2014/10/21/michael-savages-disgusting-rant-ptsd-and-depres/201248|title=Michael Savage's Disgusting Rant: PTSD And Depression Sufferers Are "Weak," "Narcissistic," "Losers"|date=October 21, 2014|author=Hananoki, Eric}}</ref> The assertion prompted criticism,<ref name=MM />
====Catholic Church and immigration==== In March 2006, Savage criticised [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] assistance to illegal immigrants (in response to statements by Cardinal [[Roger Mahony]] of Los Angeles calling it "pastoral support").<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsmax.com/archives/ic/2006/4/3/162352.shtml |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120910220924/http://www.newsmax.com/archives/ic/2006/4/3/162352.shtml |dead-url=yes |archive-date=September 10, 2012 |title=Savage Remarks Anger Catholics |publisher=[[Newsmax Media]] |date=April 3, 2006 |access-date=September 27, 2007 }}</ref> [[Bill Donohue]] of the [[Catholic League (U.S.)|Catholic League]] canceled an appearance on the show, saying "what is not fine is Savage's diatribe about the 'greedy pigs' in the Catholic Church and how 'the institution is rotten from the top to the bottom.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.catholicleague.org/release.php?id=1107 |title=Michael Savage's Catholicism |access-date=July 9, 2011 |date=March 30, 2006 |author=[[Catholic League (U.S.)|Catholic League]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101120234511/http://catholicleague.org/release.php?id=1107 |archivedate=November 20, 2010 |df=mdy }}</ref>
On March 28, 2006, Savage encouraged his listeners to burn [[Flag of Mexico|Mexican flags]] to counter pro-immigration rallies in [[California]].<ref>{{cite news|first=Kim|last=Myung Oak|title=Foreign flags create flap Mexican banners at recent rallies prompt backlash|publisher=''Rocky Mountain News''|date=March 30, 2006 }}</ref>
====C-SPAN broadcast of Talkers Award==== When ''[[Talkers Magazine]]'' awarded Savage with the publication's annual "Freedom of Speech Award," [[C-SPAN]] opted not to broadcast a pre-recorded speech that had been sent by Savage.<ref name="newsblaze.com" /> Although the award ceremony had received coverage in previous years, C-SPAN did not televise it due to its policy of televising such speeches only when delivered in person. Savage told his listeners to express their ire to C-SPAN through calls and e-mails to the organization.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.politico.com/story/2007/06/c-span-shares-lamb-skewers-on-air-004576?paginate=false|title=C-SPAN shares Lamb skewers on air|author=Mortman, Howard|work=Politico|date=June 21, 2007|access-date=August 13, 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070625212709/http://dyn.politico.com/printstory.cfm?uuid=4AFF492C-3048-5C12-0025D780C6B9F45C|archivedate=June 25, 2007|deadurl=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
====Dispute with CAIR==== In early November 2007, the [[Council on American–Islamic Relations]] (CAIR) called on radio listeners to contact companies that advertise on Savage's program to express their concerns about his comments concerning Muslims. Savage was quoted as saying Muslims "need [[deportation]]", and that adherents of Islam would do well to "take your religion and shove it up your behind" because "I'm sick of you."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/17/arts/17sava.html|title=Boycotted Radio Host Remains Unbowed|first=Jacques|last=Steinberg|date=December 17, 2007|work=The New York Times|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071221095258/http://www.nytimes.com/2007/12/17/arts/17sava.html?ei=5088&en=0052db888e9244dc&ex=1355547600&partner=rssnyt&emc=rss&pagewanted=all|archivedate=December 21, 2007|access-date=February 11, 2017|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref> On his show and website, Savage answered by accusing CAIR of supporting [[Hamas]].
On November 5, 2007, following a campaign by CAIR meant to get Savage off the air by alerting his sponsors to the nature of his comments, [[Citrix Systems|Citrix Systems, Inc.]] pulled its advertisements from his show.<ref>{{cite web|last=McClellan|first=Steve|url=http://www.adweek.com/brand-marketing/citrix-pulls-spots-savage-nation-91037/ |title=Citrix Pulls Spots From ‘Savage Nation’|work=Adweek|date=November 13, 2007|accessdate=May 2, 2018}}</ref>
Savage sued CAIR for [[copyright]] infringement for using excerpts from his show on CAIR's website.<ref>Judi McLeod, [http://www.canadafreepress.com/index.php/article/927 "One for Savage, zero for CAIR"], canadafreepress.com, December 11, 2007.</ref> The suit alleged that CAIR's repackaging of Savage's comments was "deliberately designed to obscure the specific message conveyed by Michael Savage". The excerpts included Savage's characterization of the [[Quran|Qur'an]] as "a throwback document" and a "book of hate". CAIR called the suit "bizarre, sloppy and baseless".<ref>{{cite news | last =Curtis| first =Kim | title =Radio host Michael Savage sues Islamic organization over ads | publisher=[[The Press-Enterprise]]| date =December 3, 2007| url =http://www.pe.com/ap_news/California/CA_Radio_Host_Lawsuit_317999C.shtml| access-date =December 4, 2007}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> On July 25, 2008, [[United States district court]] Judge [[Susan Illston]] dismissed Savage's suit against CAIR, holding that the posting of the audio clip was protected under [[fair use]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Egelko|first=Bob|url=https://www.sfchronicle.com/bayarea/article/Suit-against-Savage-Nation-radio-host-tossed-3275816.php|title=Suit against 'Savage Nation' radio host tossed|work=San Francisco Chronicle|date=July 26, 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080731003952/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=%2Fc%2Fa%2F2008%2F07%2F25%2FBA2111VQOI.DTL|archivedate=July 31, 2008|deadurl=no|accessdate=May 2, 2018|df=mdy-all}}</ref> The court gave Savage the opportunity to file an amended complaint if he wanted to try to cure the defects in his suit. That amended complaint alleged that CAIR was a RICO conspirator in support of terror, including the 9/11 terror attack on the World Trade Center. Permission was granted to allow that filing but on August 14, 2008, however, Savage's lawyer, [[Daniel Horowitz]], announced that Savage would not file an amended complaint and would drop the case.<ref>{{Cite news| last = Egelko| first = Bob| title = Radio host drops lawsuit against Islamic group| newspaper = [[San Francisco Chronicle]]| pages = B–4| date = August 15, 2008| url = https://www.sfchronicle.com/bayarea/article/Radio-host-drops-lawsuit-against-Islamic-group-3273421.php| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20080815135155/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=%2Fc%2Fa%2F2008%2F08%2F14%2FBAPR12BDPO.DTL| archivedate = August 15, 2008| deadurl = no| access-date = May 2, 2018| df = mdy-all}}</ref> CAIR then sought attorneys fees against Savage, Judge Illston denied that request.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rbr.com/michael-savage-beats-cair-again-in-court-ruling/|title=Michael Savage beats CAIR again in court ruling|work=Radio Business Report|date=January 28, 2009|volume=26|issue=18|accessdate=May 2, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090604224117/http://rbr.com/radio/12543.html|archivedate=June 4, 2009|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
====Autism==== In July 2008, Savage said that the increasing rate of [[autism]] diagnoses was the result of "a racket" designed to get disability payments for "poorer families who have found a new way to be parasites on the government."<ref name=NYDN>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/radio-host-michael-savage-incites-protests-autism-comments-article-1.350990|title=Radio host Michael Savage incites protests with autism comments|last=Sandoval|first=Edgar|last2=Kennedy|first2=Helen|work=[[New York Daily News]]|date=July 21, 2008|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080724233046/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/2008/07/21/2008-07-21_radio_host_michael_savage_incites_protes.html|archivedate=July 24, 2008|deadurl=no}}</ref> He returned to the subject on his July 16, 2008, show with the following remarks:
{{quote|Now, the illness du jour is autism. You know what autism is? I'll tell you what autism is. In 99 percent of the cases, it's a brat who hasn't been told to cut the act out. That's what autism is. What do you mean they scream and they're silent? They don't have a father around to tell them, "Don't act like a moron. You'll get nowhere in life. Stop acting like a [[wikt:putz|putz]]. Straighten up. Act like a man. Don't sit there crying and screaming, idiot."<ref name="Aronow">{{cite web|last1=Aronow|first1=Zachary|title=Savage on autism: "A fraud, a racket. ... In 99 percent of the cases, it's a brat who hasn't been told to cut the act out"|url=http://mediamatters.org/research/2008/07/17/savage-on-autism-a-fraud-a-racket-in-99-percent/144072|website=Media Matters|publisher=David Brock|access-date=16 November 2015|date=17 July 2008}}</ref>}}
In July 2008 the progressive pressure group [[Media Matters for America]] picketed the studios of [[WOR (AM)|WOR]] in New York, along with parents of autistic children.<ref name="Aronow" /><ref name="Yan">{{cite web|last1=Yan|first1=Lily|title=If Savage was smearing only misdiagnoses of autism, why did he previously call autism itself a "phony disease"?|url=http://mediamatters.org/research/2008/07/23/if-savage-was-smearing-only-misdiagnoses-of-aut/144127|website=Media Matters|publisher=David Brock|access-date=August 6, 2016|date=July 23, 2008}}</ref> WOR issued a statement saying, "We regret any consternation that his remarks may have caused to our listeners."<ref name=NYDN /> Also that day, the insurance company [[Aflac]] pulled its advertising,<ref>{{cite news|title=Savage Loses Advertisers|last=Steinberg|first=Jacques|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=July 23, 2008|access-date=July 23, 2008|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/23/arts/23arts-SAVAGELOSESA_BRF.html}}</ref> and the [[Supertalk Mississippi]] radio network dropped Savage's program, replacing it with ''[[Dennis Miller#The Dennis Miller Show 2|The Dennis Miller Show]]''.<ref name="STM">{{cite news|title=Station nixes 'Savage Nation'|last=Pettus|first=Gary|newspaper=[[The Clarion-Ledger]]|date=July 22, 2008|access-date=July 22, 2008|url=http://www.clarionledger.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20080722/NEWS/807220363/1001/news}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> Later that evening, Savage devoted his entire three-hour program to the subject, taking calls from parents who took issue with his comments. On that show Savage stated that his remarks had been "ripped out of context" by "far left [[Stalinism|Stalinists]]" who want him off of the air. He appeared on ''[[Larry King Live]]'' with [[Glenn Beck]] as the substitute host for [[Larry King]], and said that the real issue he was commenting on was the [[overdiagnosis]] of children due to [[Pharmaceutical industry|pharmaceutical companies]]' drive to drug children for higher profits.<ref name=NYDN /> On July 25, 2008, Autism United advocates gathered to announce that several advertisers, including [[RadioShack]], [[Sears]], [[The Home Depot]], and [[DirectBuy]], will discontinue their support for Savage's show.<ref>{{cite news|title=Autism group: Advertisers dropping Savage |last=Rosen |first=Daniel |newspaper=Newsday |date=July 25, 2008 |access-date=July 25, 2008 |url=http://www.newsday.com/news/local/newyork/ny-nysava0726,0,3274609.story |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080728100819/http://www.newsday.com/news/local/newyork/ny-nysava0726%2C0%2C3274609.story |archivedate=July 28, 2008 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
Savage's syndicator, [[Talk Radio Network]], has responded by releasing a lengthy statement, along with a selection of 20 audio clips drawn from Savage's discussions of autism, to show that the comments were taken out of context.<ref>{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080728072736/http://www.savageonautism.com/|archivedate=July 28, 2008|title=20 audio clips of Michael Savage's comments on Autism|publisher=Talk Radio Network|url=http://www.savageonautism.com|access-date=September 20, 2018|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
====Banned from entering the United Kingdom==== On May 5, 2009, it was announced by then-[[Home Secretary]] [[Jacqui Smith]] that Savage was on a [[list of people banned from entering the United Kingdom]] as he is "considered to be engaging in unacceptable behaviour by seeking to provoke others to serious criminal acts and fostering [[hatred]] which might lead to inter-community violence".<ref name="BBC">{{cite news |title=UK 'least wanted' list published |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/8033060.stm |publisher=BBC |date=May 5, 2009 |access-date=May 5, 2009 }}</ref><ref name="BBCNews">{{cite news |title= 'Who is on UK least wanted list' |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/8033319.stm |publisher=BBC |date=May 5, 2009 |access-date=May 5, 2009 }}</ref><ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/northamerica/usa/5282245/US-talkshow-host-to-sue-Jacqui-Smith-over-ban-from-Britain.html US talkshow host Michael Savage to sue Jacqui Smith over ban from Britain] Alex Spillius, telegraph.co.uk, May 6, 2009.</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://press.homeoffice.gov.uk/press-releases/hate-promoters-banned-UK-named |title=Home Office name hate promoters excluded from the UK |date=May 5, 2009 |access-date=May 6, 2009 |publisher=UK Home Office |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090507181855/http://press.homeoffice.gov.uk/press-releases/hate-promoters-banned-UK-named |archivedate=May 7, 2009 |df=mdy }}</ref> During his radio broadcast on that same day, Savage declared that he would sue Smith personally for [[defamation]], calling her a "lunatic".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/8035114.stm |title=US 'hate list' DJ to sue Britain |publisher=BBC News |work=|access-date=May 5, 2009 | date=May 6, 2009}}</ref>
During a subsequent [[NPR]] talk show, Savage said that he has never advocated violence and repeatedly invoked the [[United States Constitution]]'s [[First Amendment to the United States Constitution|First Amendment]]. After host [[Neal Conan]] pointed out that the U.S. Constitution does not apply to the United Kingdom, Savage replied, "No. Thank God I'm an American. But for this lunatic ... to link me up with [[White power skinhead|Nazi skinheads]] who are killing people in [[Russia]] ... to put me in league with [[Hamas]] murderers who killed Jews on buses, is astonishing".<ref name="NPR">{{cite news |title=Michael Savage Banned in The UK |url=https://www.npr.org/templates/transcript/transcript.php?storyId=103819122 |work=[[NPR]] |date=May 5, 2009 |access-date=August 5, 2009 }}</ref> Savage also called on his listeners to support him by canceling travel and business in Britain as well as by boycotting British-made goods, commenting, "If they want to play hardball, we'll play hardball."<ref>Kate Kelland [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/savage-response-barred-shock-jock-vows-to-sue-1679928.html "Savage response: barred shock jock vows to sue"], ''Reuters'', May 6, 2009</ref> When a caller challenged Savage about his talk show rhetoric, Savage called him a "foaming lunatic ... someone in pajamas in a mental asylum ... You're nobody and I'm not going to talk to you!" At that point, Neal Conan invited him to leave.<ref name="NPR" />
Of the banning, the [[Mayor of London]], [[Boris Johnson]], wrote: "America still has a constitutional protection of free speech, and I have been amazed ... to see how few people in this country are willing to stick up for that elementary principle ... a country once famous for free speech is now hysterically and expensively sensitive to anything that could be taken as a slight."<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/comment/columnists/borisjohnson/5304788/Michael-Savage-poses-no-risk-to-British-security-so-why-wont-MPs-say-so.html Michael Savage poses no risk to British security so why won't MPs say so?] Boris Johnson, The Daily Telegraph, May 10, 2009</ref> In ''[[The Guardian]]'', [[Catherine Bennett (journalist)|Catherine Bennett]] wrote: "The ban on Savage is so far from being a comprehensible act, so staggeringly capricious and stupid, as to defy evaluation."<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2009/may/10/michael-savage-radio-homeopathy-jacqui-smith Yes Jacqui, let's keep out those dangerous homeopaths] Catherine Bennett, ''The Guardian'', May 10, 2009</ref> While Sam Leith wrote: "Barring this shock-jock from Britain risks turning a rabid blabbermouth into a beacon for free speech."<ref name="Ref-4" />
====Veteran PTSD==== On October 14, 2014, Savage criticized veteran sufferers of [[posttraumatic stress disorder]], accusing them of "weakness". According to Savage, "Everyone has depression in their life. But if the whole nation is told, 'boo-hoo-hoo, come and get a medication, come and get treatment, talk about mental illness.' You know what you wind up with? You wind up with Obama in the White House and liars in every phase of the government. That's what you wind up with. It's a weak, sick, nation. A weak, sick, broken nation. And you need men like me to save the country. You need men to stand up and say stop crying like a baby over everything ... No wonder we're being laughed at around the world. No wonder ISIS can defeat our military."<ref name=MM2>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediaite.com/online/michael-savage-rants-against-military-ptsd-sufferers-no-wonder-isis-can-defeat-us/|title=Michael Savage Rants Against Military PTSD Sufferers: ‘No Wonder ISIS Can Defeat’ Us|website=www.mediaite.com}}</ref>
==Personal life== While in the South Pacific, he became fascinated with the 19th-century sailor [[Charles Savage (beachcomber)|Charles Savage]], who was believed to have been the first man to bring firearms to [[Fiji]].<ref name="Savage Talk">{{cite news |first=Dan |last=Fost |title=Savage talk: A Former Herbalist has Remade Himself into the Vitriol-Spewing King of the Bay Area's Afternoon Drive Time |url=http://www.sfchronicle.com/politics/article/SAVAGE-TALK-A-former-herbalist-has-remade-2672863.php |work=San Francisco Chronicle |date=February 6, 2003 |access-date=August 13, 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030224065821/http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=%2Fc%2Fa%2F2003%2F02%2F06%2FDD165846.DTL |archivedate=February 24, 2003 |deadurl=no |df=mdy-all }}</ref> That fascination led to Weiner's name change to Savage.
Savage and his second wife, Janet, have two children, a daughter and a son; his son, [[Russell Weiner]], is the founder of the company that produces the [[Rockstar (drink)|Rockstar]] energy drink.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2006/01/04/dining/04well.html?_r=1&pagewanted=2 In Oregon, Thinking Local] NY Times January 4, 2006</ref> Russell's mother, Janet, served as [[Chief financial officer|CFO]] of his company until July 2009.<ref name="sfsavage" /> In 1974, Savage and his family moved to [[Fairfax, California]] after Savage completed his master's degree at the University of Hawaii.<ref name="salon" /> Savage has homes in [[Larkspur, California|Larkspur]] and [[Tiburon, California|Tiburon]] in [[Marin County, California]], an apartment in San Francisco, as well as residences in [[Beverly Hills, California]] and [[West Palm Beach, Florida]].<ref name="salon" /><ref name="Conservative radio host enjoys liberal Marin">{{cite web|author1=Mullins, Jessica |author2=Baptista, Nicole|title=Conservative radio host enjoys liberal Marin|url=http://www.marinscope.com/twin_cities_times/news/article_38f1d6d7-16d9-500d-b8a8-11d3ec2d806d.html|website=Twin Cities Times|publisher=Marinscope Newspapers|access-date=August 11, 2014|date=May 2, 2012}}</ref><ref name="tearing it up">{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/print/2003/mar/07/entertainment/et-tempest7 |title=Tearing it up |author=Tempest, Rone |date=March 7, 2003 |work=Los Angeles Times |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030329193548/http://www.calendarlive.com/tv/radio/cl-et-tempest7mar07%2C0%2C373627.story?coll=cl-tvent |archivedate=March 29, 2003 |access-date=February 23, 2017 }}</ref>
During the 1980s, Savage attended Friday night services at a Jewish Synagogue [[Chabad house]] in Berkeley.<ref name="New Yorker" /> In a 2003 interview on ''[[The O'Reilly Factor]]'', Savage has said that although he believes in God, he attends houses of worship only once or twice a year.<ref name="O'Reilly">{{cite news|last=O'Reilly|first=Bill|title=Radio Talk Show Host Michael Savage|url=http://www.foxnews.com/on-air/oreilly/2003/09/16/radio-talk-show-host-michael-savage/print|work=The O'Reilly Factor|publisher=Fox News|access-date=July 17, 2011|date=September 16, 2003|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130725060653/http://www.foxnews.com/on-air/oreilly/2003/09/16/radio-talk-show-host-michael-savage/print|archivedate=July 25, 2013|df=mdy-all}}</ref> In his 2012 book ''Trickle Down Tyranny'', Savage wrote: "... I'm not religious. Do I believe in God? Sometimes I do, sometimes I don't."<ref>{{Citation|title = Trickle Down Tyranny: Crushing Obama's Dream of the Socialist States of America|place = New York City|publisher = William Morrow|year = 2012|pages = 63|isbn = 978-0-06-208397-5|author = Savage, Michael}}</ref>
Savage is noted as a supporter of wildlife conservation efforts, speaking out against the poaching of elephants in Africa. He has pleaded on his show and called upon President Donald J. Trump to reinstate a ban on the importation of elephant trophies.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Green |first1=Miranda |title=Elephant trophy decision faces pushback from some Trump allies |url=https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/377471-gop-torn-on-elephant-trophy-ruling-as-trump-stays-quiet |work=The Hill |date=8 March 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
Savage has had many pet dogs throughout his life, his current one being Teddy, a toy poodle.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://canadafreepress.com/article/even-michael-savages-beloved-poodleteddy-not-safe-from-crazed-anti-trump-at|title=Even Michael Savage’s beloved poodle,’Teddy’ not safe from crazed anti-Trump attac|website=canadafreepress.com|language=en|access-date=2018-08-21}}</ref>
Savage has met with President Trump on numerous occasions and was formally invited to the White House to meet with the President and Vice President Mike Pence. He had not been in Washington D.C. for three decades prior this visit.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://m.washingtontimes.com/news/2018/apr/24/inside-the-beltway-michael-savage-goes-to-washingt/|title=Inside the Beltway: Michael Savage goes to Washington, the White House included|last=http://www.washingtontimes.com|first=The Washington Times|work=The Washington Times|access-date=2018-08-21|language=en-US}}</ref>
==Books== In total, Savage has written 40 books, twenty under his real name of Michael Weiner, and twenty under his pseudonym of Michael Savage. As Michael Savage, his works include two #1 ''New York Times'' Best Sellers and three additional books which made ''[[The New York Times Best Seller list]]''.<ref name="Ref-1">{{cite web |title=Hawes New York Times Best Seller list |url=http://www.hawes.com/2004/2004-01-18.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090106021054/http://www.hawes.com/2004/2004-01-18.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=January 6, 2009 |access-date=May 9, 2009 |publisher=[[Hawes]] }}</ref><ref name="Ref-2">{{cite web |title=Hawes New York Times Best Seller list |url=http://www.hawes.com/2005/2005-05-01.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081006150437/http://www.hawes.com/2005/2005-05-01.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=October 6, 2008 |access-date=May 9, 2009 |publisher=[[Hawes]] }}</ref><ref name="Ref-3">{{cite web |title=Hawes New York Times Best Seller list |url=http://www.hawes.com/2006/2006-05-14.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081121012104/http://www.hawes.com/2006/2006-05-14.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=November 21, 2008 |access-date=May 9, 2009 |publisher=[[Hawes]] }}</ref> have also been reprinted under his alias of Michael Savage.
His earlier books as Michael A. Weiner, Ph.D., are focused around his doctoral expertise in the field of [[nutrition]]al [[ethnomedicine]]. In them, he advocates [[nutrition]]al, [[Herbalism|herbal]], and [[Homeopathy|homeopathic]] options to approach the prevention and treatment of diseases such as [[Malnutrition|poor diet]], [[Ageing|aging]], [[arthritis]], [[Alzheimer's disease]], [[cancer]], [[Allergy|allergies]], [[Cocaine dependence|cocaine addiction]], the [[common cold]], and [[HIV/AIDS]].<ref name="amazon.com">{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Michael-A.-Weiner/e/B001HCYZ9W|title=Michael A. Weiner|website=www.amazon.com}}</ref> He has also written about [[tree planting]], [[Beer sommelier#Beer tasting|beer-tasting]], and [[Nutrition|nutritional cooking]].<ref name="amazon.com" />
His more recent books as Michael Savage are political in nature and published by a variety of different companies. His recent works also include holiday family stories and thrillers.
In 1991, Savage self-published ''The Death of the White Male'', an argument against [[affirmative action]], through Quantum Books.<ref name="book">{{cite web|title =Entry for: ''The death of the white male'' |work=[[WorldCat]].org |url =http://worldcat.org/oclc/54958700?tab=holdings |access-date =January 18, 2008}}</ref> In the book, Savage, calls affirmative action "[[reverse discrimination]]", and demonstrates his emerging philosophy. This eventually led to his starting the Paul Revere Society and he continues to sell the book to raise money for this group.<ref name="death">{{cite web|title=Sponsor the Paul Revere Society |work=Paul Revere Society website |url=http://www.olsenclan.com/clients/savage/prs_sponsor.shtml |access-date=January 18, 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081211084614/http://www.olsenclan.com/clients/savage/prs_sponsor.shtml |archivedate=December 11, 2008 }}</ref>
In January 2003, Savage published ''The Savage Nation: Saving America from the Liberal Assault on Our Borders, Language and Culture'', his first major book under the pseudonym Michael Savage. The book quickly reached the top of ''The New York Times Best Seller list]'', earning Savage, as noted above, a commentary show on MSNBC. The book directs attacks at "liberal [[media bias]]", the "dominating culture of 'she-ocracy'", [[LGBT rights by country or territory|gay activists]], and liberals.
In January 2004, Savage published his second political book ''[[The Enemy Within (Savage book)|The Enemy Within: Saving America from the Liberal Assault on Our Schools, Faith, and Military]]''. His next book, ''[[Liberalism Is a Mental Disorder]]'', was released on April 12, 2005. Unlike ''The Savage Nation'', both of these books cited sources for some of the more controversial claims made.{{citation needed|date=March 2015}}
In April 2006, Savage released ''[[The Political Zoo]]''. The book contains [[Satire|satirical]] profiles and cartoons of different public figures, most of whom are liberal political figures and celebrities, depicted in [[caricature]] as animals in the "Political Zoo", with Savage portrayed as the zoo keeper.
In October 2010, Savage released ''Trickle Up Poverty: Stopping Obama's Attack on Our Borders, Economy, and Security''. Released through the [[HarperCollins]] imprint of [[William Morrow and Company]], Savage argues in the book that "Americans are boiling mad over the way Congress and this [[Marxism|Marxist]]/[[Leninism|Leninist]]-oriented President are manipulating the current economic crisis to nationalize businesses."<ref>Boog, Jason. "[http://www.mediabistro.com/galleycat/michael-savage-sells-trickle-up-poverty-to-william-morrow_b11988 Michael Savage Sells 'Trickle Up Poverty' to William Morrow]". ''Galleycat''. Media Bistro. June 17, 2010.</ref>
In November 2010, it was confirmed that Savage had signed a deal to write two thrillers for publisher St. Martin's Press. The first political thriller, ''[[Abuse of Power]]'', was released on September 13, 2011. The novel is based on "My fictionalized account of being banned from Britain and hunted by overbearing governments is set in the San Francisco only I know", said Savage. It is set in [[San Francisco]], mainly in [[North Beach, San Francisco|North Beach]], as well as [[London]], and [[Tel Aviv]]. It tells the story of a failed carjacking that reveals a government cover-up. A dark plot involving British officials and a terrorist group known as "the Hand of Allah". The publisher has described the novel by saying, "will make 9/11 look like child's play".<ref>Bosman, Julie. "[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9904E2D8133DF930A15752C1A9669D8B63 Michael Savage To Write Two Thrillers]". ''The New York Times'': November 23, 2010.</ref>
In 2014, Savage released ''Stop the Coming Civil War: My Savage Truth'', in which Savage writes in part, "We are under assault from both inside and out as our government moves to consolidate its domestic power, while at the same time weakening our defenses against the growing power of our enemies."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/nov/18/book-review-how-a-divided-nation-can-proceed/|last=Vernon|first=Wes|work=The Washington Times|date=November 18, 2014|accessdate=May 2, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141119203910/http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/nov/18/book-review-how-a-divided-nation-can-proceed/?page=all|archivedate=November 19, 2014|deadurl=no}}</ref>
In 2015, Savage released another New York Times Best Seller titled ''Government Zero: No Borders, No Language, No Culture.'' It tells of how the country has been left without the founding principles of his radio show, "borders, language and culture," and the destruction the Obama Presidency brought to the country. Savage offered several solutions as to how to rebuild the nation.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2015/sep/23/inside-the-beltway-new-book-from-michael-savage-go/|title=New book from Michael Savage: ‘Government Zero: No Borders, No Language, No Culture’|last=Harper|first=Jennifer|work=The Washington Times|date=September 23, 2015|accessdate=May 2, 2018}}</ref>
In 2016 Savage released "Scorched Earth: Restoring The Country After Obama". This New York Times best seller was a blueprint for how then candidate Donald Trump could help get the country back on the right track should he win the election.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sadar|first=Anthony J.|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2016/sep/21/book-review-scorched-earth-restoring-the-country-a/|title=Book Review: 'Scorched Earth: Restoring the Country After Obama'|work=[[The Washington Times]]|date=September 21, 2016}}</ref>
In March 2017, Savage released what he said would be his last political book, ''Trump's War: His Battle For America''. The book debuted at number one on The New York Times Best Seller List.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/mar/27/michael-savage-new-book-trumps-war-hits-no-1-on-ne/|title=Michael Savage new book 'Trump’s War' hits No. 1 on New York Times Best Seller list|last=Harper|first=Jennifer|work=[[The Washington Times]]|access-date=May 10, 2017|date=March 27, 2017}}</ref>
In November 2017 Dr. Savage released a non-political book based on his lifelong quest for spiritual truth titled, "God, Faith, and Reason." <ref>{{cite web|last=Harper|first=Jennifer|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2017/nov/13/inside-the-beltway-michael-savage-leaps-into-faith/|title=Inside the Beltway: Michael Savage leaps into faith with new book|work=[[The Washington Times]]}}</ref>

{{Unreferenced|date=January 2008}} '''Narayan Govind Kalelkar''' ([[Devanagari]]: नारायण गोविंद कालेलकर) (December 11, 1909 - 1989) was a [[linguist]] from [[Maharashtra]], [[India]].
He was born in the village of Bambuli in [[Ratnagiri District]]. He received his early college education in [[Baroda]] and [[Mumbai]] with specialization in French language, and a D.Lit. Degree from a university in [[Paris]].
He taught [[French language|French]] and Literature at Baroda Vidyapeeth, and [[Indo-Aryan languages|Indo-Aryan]]/[[Indo-European languages]] at [[Deccan College Post-Graduate and Research Institute|Deccan College]] in [[Pune]].
Kalelkar authored several books on linguistics in [[Marathi language|Marathi]], they being the first of their kind in Marathi. His ''Dhwanivichar'' (ध्वनिविचार) (1955) and ''Bhasha Ani Samskruti'' (भाषा आणि संस्कृति) (1960) received [[Maharashtra]] state's literary prizes; and his ''Bhasha: Itihas Ani Bhoogol'' (भाषा: इतिहास आणि भूगोल) (1964) received a [[Sahitya Akademi]] award in 1967.
==Contribution to Konkani language== Kalekar's study of [[Konkani Language|Konkani]] was instrumental in Sahitya Akademi's decision in 1975 to recognize Konkani as an independent Indian language (rather than being a dialect of Marathi).
